title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Sales of newly built homes dropped 10.9% in September from August, the latest sign that rising interest rates are causing an abrupt slowdown in the housing market.

Boeing said its losses deepened in the third quarter as fresh problems with its defense business added to supply-chain and regulatory woes in its commercial-jet arm.

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq lost 0.7% and 2%, respectively, dragged down by falling tech stocks, while the Dow edged up 0.01%.

Shares of Mobileye rose 38% in their trading debut, providing a rare bright spot for an IPO market that is having its worst year in memory.

Credit Suisse is nearing a deal to sell its securitized-products group to Apollo and Pimco, people familiar with the matter said.

Ford swung to a third-quarter loss because of a hefty charge associated with the shutdown of its autonomous-driving venture Argo AI.

The Bank of Canada raised its main interest rate by a smaller-than-expected half-percentage point to 3.75%.

What's News: Business & Finance
